ATTORNEY KANSAS R. GOODEN APPOINTED TO THE THIRD DISTRICT COURT OF APPEAL BY GOVERNOR RON DESANTIS

On June 28, 2024, Governor Ron DeSantis announced the appointment of Kansas R. Gooden to the Third District Court of Appeal to fill the vacancy created by the passing of Judge Eric Wm. Hendon. Ms. Gooden is board certified in appellate practice and serves as General Counsel and Appellate Group Leader at Boyd & Jenerette, P.A. She earned her bachelor’s degree from James Madison University and her juris doctorate from St. Thomas University.THE HONORABLE BRONWYN C. MILLER SPEAKS AT THE 14TH ANNUAL GETTING A HEAD START ON PRO BONO FOR SUMMER ASSOCIATES EVENT

On June 6, 2024, The Honorable Bronwyn C. Miller spoke at the 14th Annual Getting a Head Start on Pro Bono for Summer Associates hosted by Dade Legal Aid’s Put Something Back Pro Bono Project. She emphasized the importance and the rewards of giving back your time and talent by providing pro bono civil legal assistance to low-income children, individuals and families. The annual event included over 65 Summer Associates from local law firms. Getting a Head Start on Pro Bono not only increases awareness of the need for more pro bono attorneys but also provides opportunities to partake in pro bono activities such as preparing wills for Veterans, serving as a Guardian ad Litem for a child in need, or staffing a legal clinic. For more Information on how to join this worthy effort contact Karen Ladis, Executive Director, Dade Legal Aid at 305-579-5733.STUDENTS FROM MIAMI ARTS STUDIO VISIT ORAL ARGUMENTS

On June 4, 2024, students from Miami Arts Studio attended the Court's oral argument session through the ABOTA program. Chief Judge Thomas Logue, Judges Ivan F. Fernandez, Bronwyn C. Miller, and Fleur J. Lobree hosted a question-and-answer panel with the students after the session.THE HONORABLE ALEXANDER S. BOKOR DELIVERS KEYNOTE ADDRESS AT THE 66th ANNUAL NORTH DADE JUSTICE CENTER LAW DAY

On May 2, 2024, Judge Alexander S. Bokor was invited to give the keynote address at the 66th Annual North Dade Justice Center Law Day. Judge Bokor spoke on the importance of separation of powers in promoting the rule of law and guaranteeing individual liberties. The event was hosted by the Eleventh Judicial Circuit and the Judges of the North Dade Justice Center, and sponsored by several bar associations and community partners. Importantly, North Dade’s Law Day not only celebrates our constitutional system and brings together judges, lawyers, and community leaders, but also serves as an opportunity to speak, educate and answer questions from civic-minded students at Dr. Michael M. Krop Senior High School. MIAMI-DADE BAR AND MONROE COUNTY BAR CO-HOSTED THE 2024 SPRING SEMINAR

On Friday, May 3, 2024, the Miami-Dade Bar and the Monroe County Bar co-hosted a half-day seminar on extraordinary writs and interlocutory appeals at the Third District Court of Appeal. The program featured outstanding appellate advocates discussing their craft and concluded with a Q & A session featuring Judge Ivan Fernandez, Judge Ed Scales, Judge Norma Lindsey, Judge Bronwyn Miller, Judge Monica Gordo, Judge Fleur Lobree, and Judge Alex Bokor. A reception followed the seminar.THIRD DCA INDUCTION CEREMONY FOR CANDIDATES FOR ADMISSION TO THE FLORIDA BAR

On Monday, May 6, 2024, at 10:30 a.m., candidates for admission to the Florida Bar were sworn-in as new Florida attorneys at the Third District Court of Appeal.

A recording of the ceremony will be available the following day in the Special Events section of this website. THE HONORABLE NORMA S. LINDSEY RECEIVES U.M. ALUMNI ACHIEVEMENT AWARD

On Thursday, April 11, 2024, the Honorable Norma S. Lindsey received the University of Miami School of Law’s prestigious Alumni Achievement Award. This award recognizes alumni nationally who have excelled in service to the legal profession. A commercial litigator before being appointed to the bench, Judge Lindsey throughout her career has been regularly appointed by governors and Supreme Court Justices to serve on critical commissions including the District Court Performance and Accountability Commission, the Judicial Nominating Commission, and the Florida Growth Management Study Commission, among many others. Yet she has always found time to lecture in law schools, teach at judicial conferences, and judge moot court competitions. A fun fact noted at the award ceremony was that Judge Lindsey was a star in track and field as an undergraduate.ORAL ARGUMENTS HELD AT ST. THOMAS UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF LAW

On April 9, 2024, the Court convened an official oral arguments session at St. Thomas University College of Law. The judicial panel was presided by Judge Kevin Emas, Judge Edwin A. Scales III, Judge Norma S. Lindsey and Judge Bronwyn C. Miller. The Judges hosted a question-and-answer panel with the students after the session.

THIRD DISTRICT COURT OF APPEAL MOURNS THE PASSING OF THE HONORABLE ERIC WM. HENDON

With a deep sense of loss, the judges of the Third District Court of Appeal note the death of their friend and colleague the Honorable Eric Wm. Hendon. Judge Hendon brought to this Court decades of experience as a trial lawyer, appellate advocate, and trial judge, as well as kindness, humor, and good fellowship. He relished his work as an appellate judge and spoke with pleasure of getting into the zone when steeping himself in legal analysis and writing. Judge Hendon’s opinions were known for their solid craftsmanship and embodied his commitment to justice.

Judge Hendon lived a great life, overcoming much and achieving much. He was something of a child prodigy in music and education. He loved classical music, fine cars, and traveling to virtually every corner of the world with his wife, Diane Kennedy-Hendon. In everything he did, he fought the good fight, he finished the course, he kept his word. “He was a man, take him for all in all. We shall not look upon his like again.” He will be sorely missed.

Founding members of the non-profit Kozyak Minority Mentoring Foundation, John Kozyak and his wife Barbara Silverman, have established a scholarship in Judge Eric Wm. Hendon’s name. More...

THE HONORABLE BRONWYN C. MILLER MODERATES A DISCUSSION FOCUSED ON ISRAEL AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MIAMI SCHOOL OF LAW

On February 7, 2024, The Honorable Bronwyn C. Miller together with Harvard Law School Professor Emeritus, Alan Dershowitz, moderated a discussion focused on Israel. The event was a collaboration between the Jewish Comparative Law Society and Students Supporting Israel.JUSTICE JOHN D. COURIEL AND JUDGE EDWIN A. SCALES, III DURING LAST FRIDAY'S PRESENTATION TO THE MONROE COUNTY BAR ASSOCIATION

On Friday, January 26, 2024, Judge Edwin A. Scales, III and Florida Supreme Court Justice John D. Couriel spoke to the Monroe County Bar Association. The event was moderated by Harvey Sepler, Esq. The discussion focused on practice before their courts but evolved into a dialogue of professionalism in appellate practice. As it was done for many years, the Monroe County Bar Association hosted this event and it was well attended.THE HONORABLE IVAN F. FERNANDEZ HONORED FOR HIS SERVICE AS PRESIDENT OF THE FLORIDA CONFERENCE OF DCA JUDGES

On January 11, 2024, the Honorable Ivan F. Fernandez was honored for his service as president of the Florida Conference of District Court of Appeal Judges. He served from September 8, 2022, through January 11, 2024, after being elected unanimously by the district court judges in the state. His role involved working with the Florida Chief Justice, the Senate, the House, and offices of the Governor on statewide issues of judicial budgeting, administration, and education.THE HONORABLE IVAN F. FERNANDEZ HONORED FOR HIS MILITARY AND LEGAL SERVICE

On November 27, 2023, the Honorable Ivan F. Fernandez was honored for his service to our country as a U.S. Army veteran at the 3rd Annual The Florida Patriot: Honoring Legal Leader Veterans Service to Country & Community event. This statewide event was locally co-hosted by the Cuban American Bar Association (CABA), at Rivero Mestre, LLP in Coral Gables, Florida.THE HONORABLE BRONWYN C. MILLER AWARDED ANNUAL JUDICIAL VANGUARD AWARD

On November, 9, 2023, at the Annual Miami-Dade Bar Young Lawyers Section Breakfast with the Judiciary event, the Honorable Bronwyn C. Miller was presented with the First Annual Judicial Vanguard Award for her Leadership and Continued Support of the Miami-Dade Bar Young Lawyers Section.

Pictured from left to right are Third District Court of Appeal Judges Bronwyn C. Miller and Ivan F. Fernandez, and 11th Judicial Circuit Court Chief Judge Nushin Sayfie, who was also a recipient of the First Annual Judicial Vanguard Award.THE HONORABLE FLEUR J. LOBREE MODERATES FOR THE APPELLATE PRACTICE SECTION OF THE FLORIDA BAR

On November 21, 2023, Judge Fleur Lobree moderated a webcast seminar for the Florida Bar Appellate Practice Section entitled “Appellate Insights from Court Attorneys and Career Clerks.” The program focused on effective appellate advocacy from the perspective of judicial law clerks. Judge Lobree, who briefed and argued hundreds of appeals as a lawyer, also has the distinction of being the only judge at the Third District Court of Appeal who also served the Court as a staff attorney. She served under the direction of the Honorable Rodolfo Sorondo, Jr. Also speaking on the program was senior career attorney Rosa Rodriguez who has served various judges on the Third District Court of Appeal for over three decades.THIRD DCA HOSTS FIU COLLEGE OF LAW LLM STUDENTS

On October 17, 2023, the Third District Court of Appeal hosted a group of Master of Laws (LLM) students from Florida International University College of Law. The group of students, who are already licensed and practicing attorneys, come from culturally diverse backgrounds. They represent countries such as Lebanon, Venezuela, Brazil, Poland, Dominican Republic, Trinidad and Tobago, France, Colombia, Cuba, Ecuador, Hungary, Honduras, Chile, and Japan. The foreign attorneys attended an oral argument session with Chief Judge Thomas Logue and Judges Edwin A. Scales, III, Eric Wm. Hendon, Monica Gordo, and Alexander S. Bokor. Following the oral arguments, the judges held a question-and-answer session in the courtroom, and later attended a luncheon hosted by the Dean of FIU College of Law Anthony Page, Associate Dean Manuel Gomez, and Professor Rodolfo Pittaluga, Jr.THIRD DCA INDUCTION CEREMONY FOR CANDIDATES FOR ADMISSION TO THE FLORIDA BAR

On Wednesday, October 4, 2023, at 10:30 a.m., candidates for admission to the Florida Bar were sworn-in as new Florida attorneys at the Third District Court of Appeal.

A recording of the ceremony is available in the Special Events section of this website.

eDCA MOVED TO ACIS

Starting September 11, 2023, please visit the Appellate Case Information System (ACIS) located at https://acis.flcourts.gov for access to all public dockets. Please note some case dockets and documents may be restricted by rule, statute, or otherwise unavailable to the public. Attorneys of record and self-represented litigants must register to obtain access to documents in their cases. It is important to note that your ACIS account is replacing your eDCA account.

Attorneys of record who registered with ACIS for access to Supreme Court and/or First DCA do not need to re-register.

Access the registration guide here.

JUSTICE JOHN D. COURIEL VISITS THE THIRD DCA

On August 29, 2023, Justice John D. Couriel visited the Third District Court of Appeal. He was briefed by Mercy M. Prieto, the Clerk of the Court, on the work to implement C-Track, the Court’s new docketing system scheduled to go-live on September 11, 2023. “I am delighted to see the progress Mercy and her team have made,” Justice Couriel commented.ADMINISTRATIVE ORDER NO. AOSC23-48

Administrative Order No. AOSC23-48, In Re: Emergency Request to Extend Time Periods Under All Florida Rules of Procedure for the Third District Court of Appeal. THE HONORABLE EDWIN A. SCALES, III ELECTED CHIEF JUDGE-ELECT

The Judges of the Third District Court of Appeal have unanimously elected the Honorable Edwin A. Scales, III to serve as Chief Judge-Elect for a two-year term, starting on July 1, 2023, through June 30, 2025. In that capacity, Judge Scales will serve on the District Court of Appeal Budget Commission advising the Chief Justice of Florida on statewide budgeting matters. In addition, Judge Scales will continue serving as a member of Florida’s Judicial Management Council, the strategic planning committee for Florida’s judicial branch, and as chair of the Legislative Committee of the Florida Conference of District Court of Appeal judges.THE HONORABLE THOMAS LOGUE NAMED CHIEF JUDGE

On July 1, 2023, Judge Thomas Logue became the twenty-first chief judge of the Third District Court of Appeal since the court opened in 1957. His term is for two years and, as chief judge, he will be responsible for all administrative matters in the court. PRESS RELEASE. Passing of the Gavel ceremony program is available here.

NOTICE TO PARTIES AND PRACTITIONERS:

Effective January 1, 2021 at 12:03 a.m., the Florida Rules of Appellate Procedure have been modified to require, among other things, that computer-generated documents be filed in either Arial 14-point font or Bookman Old Style 14-point font. In addition, the page limits for computer-generated briefs and petitions were converted to word counts. The changes also require that the certificate of compliance at the end of a document, which is subject to a word count, certify that the document is in conformity with all font and word count requirements. To ensure compliance with the new requirements, all filers are encouraged to review the Supreme Court of Florida’s opinion at: https://www.floridasupremecourt.org/content/download/692679/opinion/sc20-597.pdf.
